titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Agreement between the City of Brooklyn and the Flatbush Railroad Company 1992.007
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:14:10 +0000.

did.unittitle: Agreement between the City of Brooklyn and the Flatbush Railroad Company
did.abstract: This document, signed by Mayor Martin Kalbfleish of the City of Brooklyn, confirms an agreement between the city and the Flatbush Railroad Company for the laying of streetcar tracks in conformity with Brooklyn city streets. The agreement also stipulates that the railroad tracks should not hinder or obstruct public traffic.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Agreement between the City of Brooklyn and the Flatbush Railroad Company, 1992.007, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
